repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
  Error handling in LSP is inconsistent and partial.

Solution:
  Consolidate error messaging.
  - Errors are always logged.
  - The user is only notified once about an error.
  - Formatting is _more_ consistent.

---

- [ ] Provide a mechanism for plugins to suppress errors and provide fallbacks?

comment_data.body:
This might be a bit aggressive, but we seem to emit the error everywhere else anyway.

Except in `_tagfunc.lua` where is error is ignored, and some places in `buf.lua` where the error isn't even checked.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -671,6 +671,11 @@ function Client:_request(method, params, handler, bufnr)
   bufnr = resolve_bufnr(bufnr)
   log.debug(self._log_prefix, 'client.request', self.id, method, params, handler, bufnr)
   local success, request_id = self.rpc.request(method, params, function(err, result)
+      -- Per LSP, don't show ContentModified error to the user.
+    if err and err.code ~= lsp.protocol.ErrorCodes.ContentModified then
+      vim.notify(string.format('[LSP][%s] %s: %s', self.name, err.code, err.message), vim.log.levels.ERROR)

comment_data.body: Note we still skip the handler in the default handlers.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -650,19 +644,6 @@ for k, fn in pairs(M) do
     end
 
     if err then
-      -- LSP spec:
-      -- interface ResponseError:
-      --  code: integer;
-      --  message: string;
-      --  data?: string | number | boolean | array | object | null;
-
-      -- Per LSP, don't show ContentModified error to the user.
-      if err.code ~= protocol.ErrorCodes.ContentModified then
-        local client = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(ctx.client_id)
-        local client_name = client and client.name or string.format('client_id=%d', ctx.client_id)
-
-        err_message(client_name .. ': ' .. tostring(err.code) .. ': ' .. err.message)
-      end
       return

comment_data.body: is it not potentially useful at "debug" level?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -561,12 +561,10 @@ local function buf_attach(bufnr)
           client.notify(ms.textDocument_willSave, params)
         end
         if client.supports_method(ms.textDocument_willSaveWaitUntil) then
-          local result, err =
+          local result =
             client.request_sync(ms.textDocument_willSaveWaitUntil, params, 1000, ctx.buf)
           if result and result.result then
             util.apply_text_edits(result.result, ctx.buf, client.offset_encoding)
-          elseif err then
-            log.error(vim.inspect(err))

comment_data.body: It's moved into `client.request`. The purpose of this PR is to centralise the error handling for LSP responses, instead of every handler doing something a little different.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -561,12 +561,10 @@ local function buf_attach(bufnr)
           client.notify(ms.textDocument_willSave, params)
         end
         if client.supports_method(ms.textDocument_willSaveWaitUntil) then
-          local result, err =
+          local result =
             client.request_sync(ms.textDocument_willSaveWaitUntil, params, 1000, ctx.buf)
           if result and result.result then
             util.apply_text_edits(result.result, ctx.buf, client.offset_encoding)
-          elseif err then
-            log.error(vim.inspect(err))

comment_data.body: IIUC, it looks like this PR centralizes the debug/trace-level logging, and drops specific user-facing messages where there is no UX benefit to them. 💯 for that, as long as we still get logging of failures for debug/trace.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -671,13 +671,32 @@ function Client:_request(method, params, handler, bufnr)
   bufnr = resolve_bufnr(bufnr)
   log.debug(self._log_prefix, 'client.request', self.id, method, params, handler, bufnr)
   local success, request_id = self.rpc.request(method, params, function(err, result)
+    -- Per LSP, don't show ContentModified error to the user.
+    if err and err.code ~= lsp.protocol.ErrorCodes.ContentModified then
+      vim.notify(
+        string.format('[LSP][%s] %s: %s', self.name, err.code, err.message),
+        vim.log.levels.ERROR
+      )
+      self:write_error(err.code, err.message)
+      api.nvim_command('redraw')
+    end
+
     local context = {
       method = method,
       client_id = self.id,
       bufnr = bufnr,
       params = params,
       version = version,
     }
+
+    if log.trace() then
+      log.trace('default_handler', method, {
+        err = err,
+        result = result,
+        ctx = vim.inspect(context),
+      })

comment_data.body:
(not a blocker) the [LSP] format is not our usual message format and seems extraneous. 

```suggestion
        string.format('LSP: %s (%s): %s', self.name, err.code, err.message),
```

+    -- Per LSP, don't show ContentModified error to the user.
+    if err and err.code ~= lsp.protocol.ErrorCodes.ContentModified then
+      vim.notify(
+        string.format('[LSP][%s] %s: %s', self.name, err.code, err.message),

comment_data.body:
Yeah, still working through some details. There are a few layers at play here. We absolutely do want to log any error that comes from a server.

I've **not** dropped the user facing messages, that's preserved in line 676, but I'm worried that calling `vim.notify` for all errors may be too much. There are some handlers that ignore errors, not sure if these are intentional.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -671,13 +671,32 @@ function Client:_request(method, params, handler, bufnr)
   bufnr = resolve_bufnr(bufnr)
   log.debug(self._log_prefix, 'client.request', self.id, method, params, handler, bufnr)
   local success, request_id = self.rpc.request(method, params, function(err, result)
+    -- Per LSP, don't show ContentModified error to the user.
+    if err and err.code ~= lsp.protocol.ErrorCodes.ContentModified then
+      vim.notify(
+        string.format('[LSP][%s] %s: %s', self.name, err.code, err.message),
+        vim.log.levels.ERROR
+      )
+      self:write_error(err.code, err.message)
+      api.nvim_command('redraw')
+    end
+
     local context = {
       method = method,
       client_id = self.id,
       bufnr = bufnr,
       params = params,
       version = version,
     }
+
+    if log.trace() then
+      log.trace('default_handler', method, {
+        err = err,
+        result = result,
+        ctx = vim.inspect(context),
+      })

comment_data.body:
> There are some handlers that ignore errors, not sure if these are intentional

We can always merge and then "burn down" those cases as we discover them :)

comment_data.body:
>  but I'm worried that calling vim.notify for all errors may be too much. There are some handlers that ignore errors, not sure if these are intentional.

There are some where we shouldn't show errors to users. 4a09c178a19097c295521892c889f1f196fff100 shows an example + context of why.

(I didn't have time yet to take a look over the diff of this PR - can do that later if desired)

comment_data.body:
Are you sure this is correct? `workspace/inlayHint/refresh` is for a request that's sent from the server to the client instead of the usual client->server handler.

These do have a response that need to be sent to the server. Same for semantic tokens below
comment_data.diff_hunk:

 end
 
 --- |lsp-handler| for the method `workspace/inlayHint/refresh`
----@param ctx lsp.HandlerContext
+---@param client_id integer
 ---@private
-function M.on_refresh(err, _, ctx, _)
-  if err then
-    return vim.NIL
-  end
-  for _, bufnr in ipairs(vim.lsp.get_buffers_by_client_id(ctx.client_id)) do
+function M.on_refresh(client_id)
+  for _, bufnr in ipairs(vim.lsp.get_buffers_by_client_id(client_id)) do

comment_data.body: This is not just for rename but also code actions and so on.

+  if not workspace_edit then

+    return

comment_data.body: Ok, I'll just revert this.

comment_data.body:
Sorry this is wrong, I was meant to revert this.

I just need to remove the error handling, since this is already covered by the boilerplate adding at the bottom of `handlers.lua`.

comment_data.body: No because a function is always returned.

comment_regular_data.body:
> Overall it's nice to have unified handling but I'm a bit worried about the implications for plugins.
It's no longer possible to have fallback handling without any error - or to replace the message with one that provides more context.

~Hmm, perhaps I can re-adjust this so we only handle errors for handlers defined in core. This will require create a private variant of `client.request` that we should use, and maintain `client.request` as the public API.~ EDIT: nah I don't think this will work.

At the very least, I think `client.request` should log every error.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(lsp): tidy up error messaging of vim.notify
